University of Cebu

COLLEGE OF INFORMATION & COMPUTER STUDIES

LABORATORY RULES AND REGULATIONS

To avoid embarrassment and maintain camaraderie with your friends and superiors at our laboratories, please observe the following:

  • Maintain silence, proper decorum, and discipline inside the laboratory. Mobile phones, walkmans, and other personal pieces of equipment must be switched off.
  • Games are not allowed inside the lab, including computer-related games, card games, and any other games that may disturb the operation of the lab.
  • Surfing the Internet is allowed only with the instructor's permission. Downloading and installing software are strictly prohibited.
  • Accessing websites not related to the course (especially pornographic and illicit sites) is strictly prohibited.
  • Deleting computer files and changing the computer setup is a major offense.
  • Observe computer time usage carefully. A fifteen-minute allowance is given for each use; otherwise, the unit will be given to those who wish to “sit-in.”

Proper Decorum Inside the Laboratory:

  • Do not enter the lab unless the instructor is present.
  • All bags, knapsacks, and similar items must be deposited at the counter.
  • Follow the seating arrangement set by your instructor.
  • At the end of class, close all software programs.
  • Return all chairs to their proper places after use.
  • Chewing gum, eating, drinking, smoking, and vandalism are prohibited inside the lab.
  • Anyone causing a continual disturbance will be asked to leave. Offensive acts, including public displays of physical intimacy, are not tolerated.
  • Persons exhibiting hostile or threatening behavior, such as yelling, swearing, or disregarding lab personnel, will be asked to leave.
  • For serious offenses, lab personnel may call the Civil Security Office (CSU) for assistance.
  • Any technical problem or difficulty must be reported to the laboratory supervisor, student assistant, or instructor immediately.

DISCIPLINARY ACTION

First Offense: The Head, Dean, or OIC recommends suspension from classes to the Guidance Center for each offender.

Second and Subsequent Offenses: A recommendation for a heavier sanction will be endorsed to the Guidance Center.
